location.description: You are on the edge of the town docks, facing a large body of water. You can see several ships moored and sailors peforming various tasks on the long wharf.
You have reached the edge of the town wall.
You have reached a hill that is too steep to climb. To the north you can see the waves of the great ocean, and to the east is an old cemetery.
You are in an old cemetery shrouded by old trees. There is a spooky feel in the air and feel that this in not a comfortable place to stay for long.
You are standing under some crumbling stone pillars. All around there are tumbledown buildings and the remains of old walls. You keep feeling that there is a strange presence nearby.
You find yourself in the wealthy district of town. The houses here are large and well-made, surrounded by high fences.
You are in the main room of the town inn, the Barking Dog. You see a crackling fire in the hearth, and a number of people drinking at tables.

You are in the bustling town market. It never seems to be empty here, and there are always merchants here at any time. You can here several voices calling out to passers-by, trying to get buyers to inspect their merchandise.
You are on well-maintained paved road that leads to the town of Renfyrd. To the west you can spy the town walls, to the north is an old graveyard, and to the southeast is a grey mountain.

You are on a broad highway that travels between the hilly region of Falsea and the town of Renfyrd. To the east the road turns round a sharp bend, while to the south the road moves toward an imposing mountain.
You find the road starts to dwindle and ends up at the base of a mountain. You can go no further this way.
